intro: Cheiranthus glaber, commonly known as the smooth wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are usually smooth and slightly succulent. Cheiranthus glaber is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
